glsa.title: cURL: Arbitrary file access
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in cURL may allow for arbitrary file access.

background.p: cURL is a command line tool for transferring files with URL syntax, supporting numerous protocols.

description.p: David Kierznowski reported that the redirect implementation accepts arbitrary Location values when CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION is enabled.

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly exploit this vulnerability to make remote HTTP servers trigger arbitrary requests to intranet servers and read or overwrite arbitrary files via a redirect to a file: URL, or, if the libssh2 USE flag is enabled, execute arbitrary commands via a redirect to an scp: URL.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
